intro: Grossheimia helenioides var. tuba, commonly known as the tuberous grossheimia, is a rare and lesser-known plant species native to specific regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its unique tuberous root system, which helps it survive in arid conditions. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming during the cooler months. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires minimal water, making it suitable for xeriscaping. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable but endangered species in its native range.
